channel.title: devAny - develop anywhere with your mobile
channel.description: Recent content on devAny - develop anywhere with your mobile

item.title: Getting started
item.description: Installation on Server This setup is NOT secure. Secure connection is highly recommended. Please follow this devAny Docker image helps to set up processes. Please install docker by following docker installation After docker is installed, you just run the following command. $ sudo docker run -d -h devany \ -v /home/devany:/home/<USERNAME> -e HOME=/home/<USERNAME> -e USERNAME=<USERNAME> -e PASSWORD=<YOUR PASSWORD> \ -p 8888:8888 -p 3000:5000 shohey1226/devany:latest Please set your <USERNAME> and <YOUR PASSWORD>.

item.title: Adding content
item.description: Hello world Let’s create our first content file for your documentation. Open a terminal and add the following command for each new file you want to add. Replace <section-name> with a general term that describes your document in detail. hugo new <section-name>/filename.md Visitors of your website will find the final document under www.example.com/<section-name>/filename/. Since it’s possible to have multiple content files in the same section I recommend to create at least one index.

item.title: Roadmap
item.description: Quo vadis? The port of the original Material theme has replicated nearly all of its features. A few are still missing but I’ve good news: the Hugo community is actively working on this issues. Maybe with the next release of Hugo we can abandon this list. Stay tuned. Localization Currently, it is possible to collect all strings in a single place for easy customization. However, this only enables you to define all strings in a single language.

item.title: devAny - Write code with your mobile
item.description: What is devAny? devAny is a mobile application that provides a development environment. The programer needs three things, 1) Terminal 2) Editor and 3) Browser and devAny provides them. This is not replacing current develpment envrinment like desktop or laptop but more like support remote work without PCs or educational purposes that people don’t have own PCs. Prerequisites DevAny app - Install app from App Store; Server - devAny doesn’t provide Unix envrionment.
